title: In the Drops: One Good Thing bars, Maap Transit kit, Sportjock Action sports bra, Ultracycling book plus squash
content:
Cyclist
In the Drops: One Good Thing bars, Maap Transit kit, Sportjock Action sports bra, Ultracycling book plus squash

Hello, and happy Friday. Here at Cyclist we have been beavering away this week.

Will delved into the 2024 men’s Tour de France route, stay peeled for his predictions on which stage Mark Cavendish is likely to get that elusive number 35th Stage. Not sure it’s time to get the wallet out just yet.

There’s also an epic bikepacking trip in Alaska’s Denali National Park and an interview with framebuilder Rubén Durán of Rizzo Cycles.

The review queen Charlotte has been at it again, this time with a guide to the best arm warmers. Hello happy elbows. We also have a review of the Specialized Tarmac SL8 S-Works Di2 and a fun Canyon Grizl vs Grail analysis.

After last week’s less joyful news about Wiggle’s future being in doubt (from our sister publication Cycling Electric), Wiggle and Chain Reaction Cycles have started their Black Friday sales for 2023 a month early so we’ve handpicked some of the best deals for you.

As for me, I am off to the New Forest this weekend to explore the National Park on foot and two wheels. And I’m going for a dip in the sea. Glorious.

Related Posts

Wiggle starts Black Friday a month early: Here are the best deals

Best of the best gravel bikes 2023: Cyclist’s top-rated gravel and adventure bikes

Best winter cycling gloves 2023: Keep your hands warm in cold weather

One Good Thing bars

A wrapper-free bar for the bike? Definitely deserves top spot in this edition of In the Drops.

One Good Thing has launched what it claims are the world’s first wrapper-free snack and protein bars.

Packing 7.5g of protein per bar and 18.4g of carbs, the bars have a natural and edible coating that acts as the wrapper. The coating is made from natural ingredients (it’s mostly beeswax) and is completely safe to eat. One Good Thing says to simply give the bars a quick rinse and chomp away. Clever.

There are plenty of flavours to choose from, including butterscotch, mango and passionfruit, berry burst, cherry bakewell, sticky ginger, banoffee, apple and cinnamon… you get the vibe.

I’ve been munching away at these bars on the bike and so far, so good. The edible wrapper reminds me of those little edible icing discs for personalised cupcakes.

I am buzzed to see a wrapper-free bar – the less plastic in this world, the better.

  • Buy now from One Good Thing (from £1.54 per bar)

Maap Transit clothing

Oh, do I have a fun outfit for you.

I am already a fan of Maap’s Transit range puffa, having taken it on a 2,000km-plus journey, and the Australian brand’s latest additions to the series are just another string to its bow.    

The women’s quarter zip is a high-neck sweater in an oversized fit and made from Polartec Power Air fabric. This material boasts efficient warmth-retention properties, and I can tell you it is bang on the money. Comfy, toasty, easy breezy to wear. The jumper comes in a grey-ish colour (shown) and a dark blue. The men’s version is a crew neck rather than quarter zip but still vibey.

Next up are the motion trousers, and my word have these become a firm favourite. If you can push past the fact they sound like waterproof trousers (small price to pay for us fashionistas), then you enter another realm of comfort and practical-ness.

Made from a lightweight, 4-way stretch technical fabric, the trousers are quick-drying, have an elasticated waist and gloriously functional zip pockets. Most importantly, they are seriously comfortable without being trackies. I like to think of it as effortless, practical chic.

  • Buy the women’s Power Air ¼ Zip from Maap (£120)
  • Buy the men’s Power Air Crew from Maap (£120)
  • Buy the women’s Motion Pant from Maap (£120)
  • Buy the men’s Motion Pant 2.0 from Maap (£120)

Sportjock Action sports bra

The Sportjock Action Sports Bra is a wire-free compression style sports bra that comes in a rather marvellous rainbow of colours. The bra features a Powerband support system and an inner layer that swiftly wicks away moisture.

I’ve been riding around in mine for a while now, and even took it on a recent trip to Jordan, where it performed spectacularly well. It’s so incredibly comfortable that it’s easy to forget you are wearing it.

What’s particularly noteworthy about this bra is that it comes in sizes suited for A-C cups and in a ‘Super’ version for cups D-F. So nearly everyone is covered.

The Sportjock Action Sports Bra is not adjustable so make sure you check the size guide, or better still, Boobydoo offers a free bra fitting service (online and in person) to ensure you find the right fit.

  • Buy the Sportjock Action Sports Bra from Boobydoo (£29.99)
  • Buy the Sportjock Super Sports Bra from Boobydoo (£31.99)

Ultra Cycling & Bikepacking: All you need to know! by Stefan Barth

From breaking down why long-distance riding is so fascinating to the science of endurance, tips for season planning, training plans and strategy on and off the bike, this book is brimming with wisdom.

Stefan Barth is a medical fitness coach, triathlete and ultracyclist, and he has also drawn on the experiences of ultracyclists such as Christoph Strasser, Lael Wilcox, James Hayden and Jenny Tough, which gives the book a well-rounded approach to the discipline.

Barth combines theory and practice to provide a seriously in depth training support manual for any long distance cycling aspirants, no matter what level.

The book will be available for purchase starting from November 1st (Tuesday next week).

  • Buy from Waterstones (£34.90)

Ad feature

Ribble Endurance AL Disc, now in ‘Enthusiast’ edition

The Endurance AL Disc is an aluminium endurance road bike that is designed to offer an exhilarating mixture of speed and efficiency for those long days in the saddle.

With its mile-eating comfort and race-like performance, the Endurance AL is the perfect choice for the amateur racer, everyday commuter, and weekend hero. For the Enthusiast Edition, we’ve selected the premium mechanical gear shifts of Shimano’s latest 105 12-speed group set.

The latest iteration of the ever popular 105 boasts cascaded 12-speed technology from top-tier Dura-Ace, wider gear ratios to go after ever greater challenges and the consummate all-condition stopping power of hydraulic disc brakes. Mavic Aksium wheels fitted with Continental Ultra Sport tyres are a strong and dependable combination for year-round road riding.

Buy the Ribble Endurance AL Disc Enthusiast now for £1,499

Ad feature ends

What we’re into this week: Squash

I’ve taken up a new hobby: squash.

I play in the evenings with a friend and it is unbelievable amounts of fun. We started off buying two matching rackets and laughing our way through getting to grips with the game, whipping the ball here, there and everywhere, leaping and running about the court.

It has now become a firm evening spot in the weekly calendar.

We’ve watched copious amount of YouTube videos, copying the drills, and learning the rules (bending them sometimes) but this has to be my favourite video of them all.

Hi, I’m Emma Cole and I love squash.
